questions.question: Why did the king blame the merchant? (Variant 51)
questions.answer: Because the wall belonged to him.

questions.question: Why did the blame keep moving from person to person? (Variant 52)
questions.answer: Because each character pushed responsibility away.

questions.question: What kind of king ruled the city? (Variant 53)
questions.answer: A foolish king who made decisions without thinking.

questions.question: Why did people obey the king’s strange decisions? (Variant 54)
questions.answer: They feared punishment and did not question him.

questions.question: Why was the disciple arrested? (Variant 55)
questions.answer: Because he fit the size needed for the execution.

questions.question: What was the disciple’s reaction to being caught? (Variant 56)
questions.answer: He protested and argued but was helpless.

questions.question: Why was the potter dragged into the case? (Variant 57)
questions.answer: He and his daughter made weak mortar used in the wall.

questions.question: What mistake did the goldsmith make? (Variant 58)
questions.answer: He distracted workers by demanding pottery urgently.

questions.question: Who finally took the responsibility for justice? (Variant 59)
questions.answer: The wise guru arrived and saved the situation.

questions.question: What is the main message of the play? (Variant 60)
questions.answer: Blind obedience leads to injustice.

questions.question: Describe how blame passed from character to character in the play. (Insight 151)
questions.answer: The merchant was blamed, then the bricklayer, the mortar-maker, the potter and finally the goldsmith as everyone avoided responsibility.

questions.question: Explain why the disciple was chosen for punishment and how irony is shown. (Insight 152)
questions.answer: He was chosen only because he fit the size for execution, showing absurd and unfair justice—punishing the innocent instead of the guilty.

questions.question: Discuss how the play shows foolish justice under an ignorant ruler. (Insight 153)
questions.answer: The king followed humourless logic, gave random orders, and punished without reason, proving that unchecked power causes harm.

questions.question: Explain the role of the guru in saving the disciple. (Insight 154)
questions.answer: The guru heard of the disciple’s situation and used wisdom to trick the king, saving his disciple from meaningless punishment.

questions.question: What lesson does the audience learn from the play? (Insight 155)
questions.answer: Justice must use reason, fairness and thought; rulers must avoid blind commands and citizens must question wrong authority.
